rounds.system_prompt: You are an expert C refactoring assistant. Define file-level constants for repeated literals used across functions.
rounds.user_prompt:
Identify descriptive constants for these numeric literals used across multiple contexts.
Return JSON: {"extractions":[{"value":string,"name":string,"type":string,"scope":string,"occurrences":[int],"function":string}]}
Valid types: define, const_var. Scope must be global or file.
Names must be unique across the entire file and not clash with existing identifiers.
Re-use previously defined constants when the meaning matches, but feel free to introduce a distinct name when the literal carries a different semantic role.
Candidates:
- value 32 (count 1 lines [244])
    example: block.__FIXME__l_struct_struct_OC_dim3_field1 = 32;
- value 12 (count 1 lines [252])
    example: memcpy(((uint8_t*)(&__FIXME__agg_2e_tmp2)), ((uint8_t*)(&block)), 12);
Only suggest replacements for the exact numeric literals listed above. Do not invent new expressions or sizeof-derived values.
Skip loop increments or obvious counters unless they appear multiple times with semantic meaning.

Reference file: /scratch/ah7226/xstack-benchmark/polybench-lilac/gemm/gemm_cpu.c
